subject: Investing
title: Who Issues Bonds and Why
description: A 60-second lesson on Who Issues Bonds and Why.

hook.text: The US government borrows $1 trillion per year through bonds. Apple borrows billions too. Even cities do it.

buildup.text: Governments issue bonds to fund deficits. Corporations do it to expand. Municipalities build roads and schools.

discovery.text: Each issuer carries different risk. US Treasuries are considered risk-free. Corporate bonds can default.

twist.text: Apple borrows through bonds despite having $60 billion in cash. Low rates make borrowing cheaper than spending cash.

climax.text: The creditworthiness of the issuer determines the interest rate. Riskier borrowers pay more to attract lenders.

punchline.text: Everyone borrows. The interest rate tells you how much the market trusts them.

quiz.question: Why would a cash-rich company like Apple issue bonds?
options: Borrowing at low rates preserves cash for other uses
They have no other way to raise money
